newsitem.title: BULGARIA: World Bank, Bulgaria agree on grain policy.
newsitem.headline: World Bank, Bulgaria agree on grain policy.

text.p: The World Bank agreed on Wednesday with Bulgaria's proposal to introduce a temporary tax on grain exports, easing the path for World Bank loans, the head of parliament's economy committee said.
"The World Bank team agreed to accept a temporary grain exports tax to be in effect until the end of the autumn," Nikola Nikolov told reporters.

A World Bank mission arrived in Bulgaria two days ago to smooth differences over grain trade policy with the government which considered imposing a 15 percent grain export fee contrary to multilaterals' recommendations.

Bulgaria freed prices and trade rules in line with agreements with the Bank and the IMF reached two months ago. But pending grain shortages have prompted the government to seek partial protectionist measures.

Preliminary estimates show Bulgaria needs to import more than a million tonnes of grain to cover the gap until next year's crop after uncontrolled grain exports two years ago caused a grave grain crisis earlier this year.
The World Bank team visit aims to ensure that the new reformist government which took office last month will continue the fast pace of structural reform started by the interim cabinet in March.
The mission's report to the World Bank board is expected to unlock a tranche of $290 million loans earmarked for Bulgaria.
